feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 29 at 2:59AM AKST until November 29 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Koyukuk Valley.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 10:25PM AKST until November 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PASSING FRONT TO BRING SNOW TO NORTHERN LYNN CANAL... .Northerly winds ahead of a gale force front will bring in below freezing temperatures to the northern panhandle on Wednesday. Wednesday afternoon, the associated front will bring moisture to the panhandle that will last into Thursday. As this moisture collides with the cold air in the north, snow is likely. For the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan

entry.summary: ...Increased Fire Weather Danger Today... A dry air mass will be over eastern Kentucky today and this will result in minimum relative humidities of around 30 percent. entry.summary: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho and Central, East Central, North Central, and Northeast Washington.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County

entry.title: Air Stagnation Advisory issued November 28 at 5:20PM PST until November 30 at 11:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground
